content:
Here's what I found:

**Spa and Wellness Center:**

* **The Fairmont San Francisco**: Has a 9,000 sq. ft. Spa at The Fairmont, offering massages, facials, and body treatments. They also have a relaxation lounge and a eucalyptus-infused steam room.
* **The Ritz-Carlton, San Francisco**: Has a 10,000 sq. ft. Spa De La Paz, offering massages, facials, and body treatments. They also have a fitness center, sauna, and steam room.
* **The St. Regis San Francisco**: Has a 10,000 sq. ft. Remède Spa, offering massages, facials, and body treatments. They also have a fitness center, sauna, and steam room.
* **Hotel Nikko San Francisco**: Has a 3,000 sq. ft. Spa at Nikko, offering massages, facials, and body treatments. They also have a fitness center and sauna.
* **Grand Hyatt San Francisco**: Has a 24-hour StayFit fitness center and a spa offering massages and facials.

**Fitness Classes and Personal Training:**

* **The Fairmont San Francisco**: Offers fitness classes, including yoga and Pilates, as well as personal training sessions. They also have a fitness center with cardio equipment and free weights.
* **The Ritz-Carlton, San Francisco**: Offers fitness classes, including yoga and Pilates, as well as personal training sessions. They also have a fitness center with cardio equipment and free weights.
* **The Westin St. Francis San Francisco on Union Square**: Offers fitness classes, including yoga and Pilates, as well as personal training sessions. They also have a fitness center with cardio equipment and free weights.
* **Hyatt Regency San Francisco**: Offers fitness classes, including yoga and Pilates, as well as personal training sessions. They also have a 24-hour StayFit fitness center with cardio equipment and free weights.
* **Omni San Francisco Hotel**: Offers fitness classes, including yoga and Pilates, as well as personal training sessions. They also have a fitness center with cardio equipment and free weights.
* **Grand Hyatt San Francisco**: Offers fitness classes, including yoga and Pilates, as well as personal training sessions. They also have a 24-hour StayFit fitness center with cardio equipment and free weights.

**Other Wellness Amenities:**

* **Hotel Zeppelin**: Offers a yoga mat and exercise ball in every room, as well as a 24-hour fitness center with cardio equipment and free weights.
* **Hotel Zelos San Francisco**: Offers a 24-hour fitness center with cardio equipment and free weights, as well as a yoga mat and exercise ball in every room.

Please note that fitness class schedules and personal training sessions may vary, and some services may incur an additional fee. It's always a good idea to check with the hotel or spa directly for the most up-to-date information.
